meanings.definition: To act in a subservient manner; to be overly obedient or submissive.
meanings.sent1: She was always truckling to her boss, doing whatever he asked without question.
meanings.sent2: The servant was truckling to the king, bowing deeply and following his every command.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was truckling to its owner, wagging its tail and rolling over for belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of truckling to the wealthy donors, always agreeing with their demands.
meanings.sent5: The student was truckling to the teacher, completing extra assignments to impress her.

meanings.definition: To flatter or fawn over someone in order to gain favor.
meanings.sent1: He was constantly truckling to his supervisor, complimenting her work to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson was truckling to the customer, praising their choices to make a sale.
meanings.sent3: The cat was truckling to its owner, rubbing against their legs and purring for attention.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity was tired of people truckling to them, always seeking autographs and selfies.
meanings.sent5: The student was truckling to the principal, offering to help with school events to be noticed.

meanings.definition: To yield or give in to someone's demands or wishes.
meanings.sent1: She was truckling to her friend's request, agreeing to go to the movie even though she preferred staying in.
meanings.sent2: The manager was truckling to the demands of the shareholders, implementing changes against his better judgment.
meanings.sent3: The child was truckling to their sibling, sharing their favorite toy without hesitation.
meanings.sent4: The employee was truckling to the unreasonable demands of the boss, working overtime without complaint.
meanings.sent5: The student was truckling to the teacher's instructions, following them to the letter for a good grade.
